education.institution: University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, United States
education.degree: B.S. Computer Science, Data Science, and Mathematics
education.description: Specializing in theoretical computer science and machine learning.
details: James B. Angell Scholar Award and University Honors recipient.
Specialize in machine learning and natural language processing.
Focused coursework in financial mathematics and risk management.
Student representative for computer science students in the ADP program.
Researched and developed language model-driven solutions, enhancing data classification accuracy and effectiveness.
Conducted error analysis and applied data cleaning, improving model reliability and outcomes.
Initiated data augmentation techniques, achieving performance gains that supported key objectives.

research_experience.organization: The Fields Institute for Research in Mathematical Sciences, Canada
details: Research: Multilingual NLP for low-resource languages, emphasizing the intersection of mathematics, social science, and machine learning.
Conducted studies on linguistic data integrity and reproducibility in typological databases.
Performed regression analysis to explore influential factors on machine translation performance.
Research: Mathematics education using open software and textbooks in undergraduate settings.
Developed open-source interactive textbooks that better support the teaching and learning of Calculus, Linear Algebra, and Abstract Algebra.
Analyzed students' reasoning in answering reading questions embedded in an interactive Linear Algebra textbook various cognitive and learning theories.
